10306<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46686&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046686&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10307External radiation therapy</a>

10308 uses a machine outside the body to send radiation toward the area of the body with cancer.</li>

10309

10310 <li>

10311<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46345&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046345&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10312Internal radiation therapy</a>

10313 uses a <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46550&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046550&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10314radioactive</a>

10315 substance sealed in needles, <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=257219&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000257219&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10316seeds</a>

10317, wires, or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45637&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045637&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10318catheters</a>

10319 that are placed directly into or near the cancer.</li>

10320

10321 </ul>

10322</div>

10323

10324 <p tabindex="-1">

10325Osteosarcoma and UPS cells are not killed easily by external radiation therapy. It may be used when a small amount of cancer is left after surgery or used together with other treatments.</p>

10326

10327 </section>

10328<section>

10329<h4 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10330Samarium</h4>

10331

10332 <p tabindex="-1">

10333<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45874&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045874&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10334Samarium</a>

10335 is a <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44455&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044455&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10336radioactive drug</a>

10337 that targets areas where bone cells are growing, such as tumor cells in bone. It helps relieve pain caused by cancer in the bone and it also kills <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270735&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270735&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10338blood</a>

10339 cells in the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45622&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045622&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10340bone marrow</a>

10341. It is used to treat osteosarcoma that has come back after treatment in a different bone.</p>

10342

10343 <p tabindex="-1">

10344Treatment with samarium may be followed by <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46695&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046695&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10345stem cell transplant</a>

10346. Before treatment with samarium, <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46598&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046598&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10347stem cells</a>

10348 (immature blood cells) are removed from the blood or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45622&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045622&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10349bone marrow</a>

10350 of the patient and are frozen and stored. After treatment with samarium is complete, the stored stem cells are thawed and given back to the patient through an <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45738&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045738&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10351infusion</a>

10352. These reinfused stem cells grow into (and restore) the body's blood cells.</p>

10353

10354 </section>

10355<section>

10356<h4 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10357Targeted therapy </h4>

10358

10359 <p tabindex="-1">

10360<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10361Targeted therapy</a>

10362 uses drugs or other substances to block the action of specific <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46081&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046081&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10363enzymes</a>

10364, <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46092&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046092&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10365proteins</a>

10366, or other <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45065&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045065&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10367molecules</a>

10368 involved in the growth of <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45614&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045614&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10369benign</a>

10370 or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45772&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045772&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10371malignant</a>

10372 tumor cells. There are different types of targeted therapy:</p>

10373

10374 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10375

10376 <ul>

10377<li>

10378<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=750798&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000750798&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10379Kinase inhibitor</a>

10380 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44737&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044737&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10381therapy</a>

10382 blocks a protein needed for cancer cells to divide. <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=509041&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000509041&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10383Sorafenib</a>

10384 is a type of kinase inhibitor therapy used to treat <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45862&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045862&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10385recurrent</a>

10386 osteosarcoma. <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10387Cabozantinib</a>

10388 is a type of kinase inhibitor that is being studied for the treatment of newly <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10389diagnosed</a>

10390 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10391localized</a>

10392 and <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10393metastatic</a>

10394 osteosarcoma. <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=740896&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000740896&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10395Regorafenib</a>

10396 is a type of kinase inhibitor that is being studied in adults for the treatment of metastatic osteosarcoma that has recurred. <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=769612&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000769612&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10397Lenvatinib</a>

10398 is a type of kinase inhibitor that may be used to treat recurrent osteosarcoma.</li>

10399

10400 <li>

10401<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=753869&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000753869&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10402Mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR) inhibitors</a>

10403 block a protein called <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=653126&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000653126&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10404mTOR</a>

10405, which may keep cancer cells from growing and prevent the growth of new <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45020&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045020&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10406blood vessels</a>

10407 that tumors need to grow. <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=386203&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000386203&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10408Everolimus</a>

10409 is an mTOR inhibitor used to treat recurrent osteosarcoma.</li>

10410

10411 </ul>

10412</div>

10413

10414 </section>

10415</section>

10416<section>

10417<h3 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10418Treatment for osteosarcoma or UPS may cause side effects.</h3>

10419

10420 <p tabindex="-1">

10421For information about <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10422side effects</a>

10423 that begin during treatment for cancer, see our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/side-effects" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/side-effects">

10424Side Effects</a>

10425 page.</p>

10426

10427 <p tabindex="-1">

10428<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10429Side effects</a>

10430 from cancer treatment that begin after treatment and continue for months or years are called <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=390292&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000390292&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10431late effects</a>

10432. Late effects of cancer treatment may include the following:</p>

10433

10434 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10435

10436 <ul>

10437<li>

10438Physical problems, such as infertility.</li>

10439

10440 <li>

10441Changes in mood, feelings, thinking, learning, or memory.</li>

10442

10443 <li>

10444<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46658&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046658&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10445Second cancers</a>

10446 (new types of cancer), such as <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=444971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000444971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10447breast cancer</a>

10448 or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46347&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046347&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10449acute myeloid leukemia</a>

10450.</li>

10451

10452 </ul>

10453</div>

10454

10455 <p tabindex="-1">

10456Some late effects may be treated or controlled. It is important to talk with your child's doctors about the effects cancer treatment can have on your child. For more information, see <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/childhood-cancers/late-effects-pdq">

10457Late Effects of Treatment for Childhood Cancer</a>

10458. </p>

10459

10460 </section>

10461<section>

10462<h3 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10463New types of treatment are being tested in clinical trials. </h3>

10464

10465 <p tabindex="-1">

10466Information about ongoing clinical trials is available from the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials">

10467NCI website</a>

10468.</p>

10469

10470 </section>

10471<section>

10472<h3 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10473Patients may want to think about taking part in a clinical trial.</h3>

10474

10475 <p tabindex="-1">

10476For some patients, taking part in a <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10477clinical trial</a>

10478 may be the best treatment choice. Clinical trials are part of the cancer research process. Clinical trials are done to find out if new cancer treatments are safe and effective or better than the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44930&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044930&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10479standard treatment</a>

10480.</p>

10481

10482 <p tabindex="-1">

10483Many of today's standard treatments for cancer are based on earlier clinical trials. Patients who take part in a clinical trial may receive the standard treatment or be among the first to receive a new treatment.</p>

10484

10485 <p tabindex="-1">

10486Patients who take part in clinical trials also help improve the way cancer will be treated in the future. Even when clinical trials do not lead to effective new treatments, they often answer important questions and help move research forward.</p>

10487

10488 </section>

10489<section>

10490<h3 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10491Patients can enter clinical trials before, during, or after starting their cancer treatment.</h3>

10492

10493 <p tabindex="-1">

10494Some clinical trials only include patients who have not yet received treatment. Other trials test treatments for patients whose cancer has not gotten better. There are also clinical trials that test new ways to stop cancer from <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10495recurring</a>

10496 (coming back) or reduce the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046580&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10497side effects</a>

10498 of cancer treatment.</p>

10499

10500 <p tabindex="-1">

10501Clinical trials are taking place in many parts of the country. Information about clinical trials supported by NCI can be found on NCI’s <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search">

10502clinical trials search</a>

10503 webpage. Clinical trials supported by other organizations can be found on the <a href="https://clinicaltrials.gov/" title="https://clinicaltrials.gov/">

10504ClinicalTrials.gov</a>

10505 website.</p>

10506

10507 </section>

10508<section>

10509<h3 type="keypoint" do-not-show="toc">

10510Follow-up tests may be needed.</h3>

10511

10512 <p tabindex="-1">

10513Some of the tests that were done to <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10514diagnose</a>

10515 the cancer or to find out the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45885&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045885&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10516stage</a>

10517 of the cancer may be repeated. Some tests will be repeated in order to see how well the treatment is working. Decisions about whether to continue, change, or stop treatment may be based on the results of these tests.</p>

10518

10519 <p tabindex="-1">

10520Some of the tests will continue to be done from time to time after treatment has ended. The results of these tests can show if your child's <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=651193&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000651193&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10521condition</a>

10522 has changed or if the cancer has <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10523recurred</a>

10524 (come back). These tests are sometimes called <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44671&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044671&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10525follow-up</a>

10526 tests or check-ups.</p>

10527

10528 </section>

10529</div>

10530

10531 </div>

10532

10533 <h3>

10534Treatment of Localized Osteosarcoma and Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma (UPS) of Bone</h3>

10535

10536 <div class="pdq-sections">

10537

10538 <div class="pdq-sections">

10539

10540 <p tabindex="-1">

10541For information about the treatments listed below, see the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq#_59">

10542Treatment Option Overview</a>

10543 section.</p>

10544

10545 <p tabindex="-1">

10546Treatment of newly <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10547diagnosed</a>

10548 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10549localized</a>

10550 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10551osteosarcoma</a>

10552 and UPS of bone may include the following:</p>

10553

10554 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10555

10556 <ul>

10557<li>

10558<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10559Surgery</a>

10560 to remove the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45847&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045847&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10561primary tumor</a>

10562. </li>

10563

10564 <li>

10565<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10566Chemotherapy</a>

10567 may be given before or after surgery to remove the primary tumor.</li>

10568

10569 <li>

10570<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10571Radiation therapy</a>

10572 if surgery cannot be done or if the tumor was not completely removed by surgery.</li>

10573

10574 <li>

10575A <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10576clinical trial</a>

10577 comparing <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45650&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045650&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10578combination chemotherapy</a>

10579 with or without the addition of <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10580cabozantinib</a>

10581 in treating patients with newly diagnosed localized or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10582metastatic</a>

10583 osteosarcoma.</li>

10584

10585 </ul>

10586</div>

10587

10588 <p tabindex="-1">

10589Use our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search">

10590clinical trial search</a>

10591 to find NCI-supported cancer clinical trials that are accepting patients. You can search for trials based on the type of cancer, the age of the patient, and where the trials are being done. <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/">

10592General information</a>

10593 about clinical trials is also available.</p>

10594

10595 </div>

10596

10597 </div>

10598

10599 <h3>

10600Treatment of Metastatic Osteosarcoma and Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma (UPS) of Bone</h3>

10601

10602 <div class="pdq-sections">

10603

10604 <div class="pdq-sections">

10605

10606 <p tabindex="-1">

10607For information about the treatments listed below, see the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq#_59">

10608Treatment Option Overview</a>

10609 section.</p>

10610

10611 <p tabindex="-1">

10612<strong>

10613Lung Metastasis</strong>

10614</p>

10615

10616 <p tabindex="-1">

10617When <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10618osteosarcoma</a>

10619 or UPS spreads, it usually spreads to the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270740&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270740&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10620lung</a>

10621. Treatment of newly <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046450&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10622diagnosed</a>

10623 osteosarcoma and UPS with <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45315&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045315&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10624lung metastasis</a>

10625 may include the following:</p>

10626

10627 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10628

10629 <ul>

10630<li>

10631<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10632Chemotherapy</a>

10633 followed by <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10634surgery</a>

10635 to remove the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45847&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045847&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10636primary cancer</a>

10637. This is followed by <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=43980&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000043980&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10638postoperative</a>

10639 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45650&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045650&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10640combination chemotherapy</a>

10641, then surgery to remove the cancer in the lung and more postoperative chemotherapy.</li>

10642

10643 <li>

10644A <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10645clinical trial</a>

10646 comparing combination chemotherapy with or without the addition of <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000743915&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10647cabozantinib</a>

10648 in treating patients with newly diagnosed <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045754&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10649localized</a>

10650 or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044058&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10651metastatic</a>

10652 osteosarcoma.</li>

10653

10654 </ul>

10655</div>

10656

10657 <p tabindex="-1">

10658<strong>

10659Bone Metastasis or Bone with Lung Metastasis</strong>

10660</p>

10661

10662 <p tabindex="-1">

10663Newly diagnosed osteosarcoma and UPS may spread to a distant bone and/or the lung. Treatment may include the following:</p>

10664

10665 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10666

10667 <ul>

10668<li>

10669Chemotherapy followed by surgery to remove the primary tumor and the cancer that has spread to other parts of the body. More chemotherapy is given after surgery.</li>

10670

10671 <li>

10672Surgery to remove the primary tumor, followed by chemotherapy and surgery to remove cancer that has spread to other parts of the body, followed by combination chemotherapy.</li>

10673

10674 <li>

10675<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10676Radiation therapy</a>

10677 to tumors in the bones.</li>

10678

10679 <li>

10680A clinical trial comparing combination chemotherapy with or without the addition of cabozantinib in treating patients with newly diagnosed localized or metastatic osteosarcoma.</li>

10681

10682 </ul>

10683</div>

10684

10685 <p tabindex="-1">

10686Use our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search">

10687clinical trial search</a>

10688 to find NCI-supported cancer clinical trials that are accepting patients. You can search for trials based on the type of cancer, the age of the patient, and where the trials are being done. <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/">

10689General information</a>

10690 about clinical trials is also available.</p>

10691

10692 </div>

10693

10694 </div>

10695

10696 <h3>

10697Treatment of Recurrent Osteosarcoma and Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma (UPS) of Bone</h3>

10698

10699 <div class="pdq-sections">

10700

10701 <div class="pdq-sections">

10702

10703 <p tabindex="-1">

10704For information about the treatments listed below, see the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq#_59">

10705Treatment Option Overview</a>

10706 section.</p>

10707

10708 <p tabindex="-1">

10709Treatment of <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45862&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045862&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10710recurrent</a>

10711 <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10712osteosarcoma</a>

10713 and UPS of bone may include the following:</p>

10714

10715 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10716

10717 <ul>

10718<li>

10719<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045570&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10720Surgery</a>

10721 to remove <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45333&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045333&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10722cancer</a>

10723 in all areas where it has spread.</li>

10724

10725 <li>

10726<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045214&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10727Chemotherapy</a>

10728 and <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10729targeted therapy</a>

10730 (<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=509041&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000509041&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10731sorafenib</a>

10732, <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=740896&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000740896&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10733regorafenib</a>

10734, <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=769612&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000769612&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10735lenvatinib</a>

10736, or <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=386203&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000386203&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10737everolimus</a>

10738).</li>

10739

10740 <li>

10741<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45874&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045874&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10742Samarium</a>

10743 and <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044971&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10744radiation therapy</a>

10745.</li>

10746

10747 </ul>

10748</div>

10749

10750 <p tabindex="-1">

10751Treatment depends on the area and type of recurrence, for example:</p>

10752

10753 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10754

10755 <ul>

10756<li>

10757For <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46634&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046634&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10758tumors</a>

10759 that have <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046556&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10760recurred</a>

10761 in the same bone where the cancer started:

10762 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10763

10764 <ul>

10765<li>

10766Surgery.</li>

10767

10768 <li>

10769Radiation therapy.</li>

10770

10771 </ul>

10772</div>

10773</li>

10774

10775 <li>

10776For tumors that have recurred in the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270740&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270740&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10777lung</a>

10778 only:

10779 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10780

10781 <ul>

10782<li>

10783Surgery.</li>

10784

10785 <li>

10786Chemotherapy.</li>

10787

10788 <li>

10789Targeted therapy.</li>

10790

10791 <li>

10792A <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10793clinical trial</a>

10794 comparing two different types of surgery (<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45926&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045926&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10795thoracotomy</a>

10796 and video-assisted <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46119&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046119&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10797thoracoscopic</a>

10798 surgery) in treating patients with osteosarcoma that has spread to the lung.</li>

10799

10800 </ul>

10801</div>

10802</li>

10803

10804 <li>

10805For tumors that have recurred in bones other than where the cancer started:

10806 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10807

10808 <ul>

10809<li>

10810Surgery.</li>

10811

10812 <li>

10813 Samarium with or without <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=46598&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000046598&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10814stem cells</a>

10815, as <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45815&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045815&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10816palliative treatment</a>

10817 to relieve pain and improve the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45417&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045417&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10818quality of life</a>

10819.</li>

10820

10821 </ul>

10822</div>

10823</li>

10824

10825 <li>

10826For tumors that have recurred twice:

10827 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10828

10829 <ul>

10830<li>

10831Surgery to remove the cancer and/or chemotherapy.</li>

10832

10833 </ul>

10834</div>

10835</li>

10836

10837 </ul>

10838</div>

10839

10840 <p tabindex="-1">

10841<a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045961&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10842Clinical trials</a>

10843 for treatment of recurrent <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045395&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10844osteosarcoma</a>

10845 and UPS of bone may include the following:</p>

10846

10847 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10848

10849 <ul>

10850<li>

10851A clinical trial that checks a sample of the patient's tumor for certain <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45693&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045693&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10852gene</a>

10853 changes. The type of <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000270742&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10854targeted therapy</a>

10855 that will be given to the patient depends on the type of gene change.</li>

10856

10857 <li>

10858A clinical trial of a new <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=797381&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000797381&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10859immune cell</a>

10860 therapy.</li>

10861

10862 </ul>

10863</div>

10864

10865 <p tabindex="-1">

10866Use our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/search">

10867clinical trial search</a>

10868 to find NCI-supported cancer clinical trials that are accepting patients. You can search for trials based on the type of cancer, the age of the patient, and where the trials are being done. <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/">

10869General information</a>

10870 about clinical trials is also available.</p>

10871

10872 </div>

10873

10874 </div>

10875

10876 <h3>

10877To Learn More About Osteosarcoma and Undifferentiated Pleomorphic Sarcoma (UPS) of Bone</h3>

10878

10879 <div class="pdq-sections">

10880

10881 <div class="pdq-sections">

10882

10883 <p tabindex="-1">

10884For more information from the <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=44266&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000044266&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10885National Cancer Institute</a>

10886 about osteosarcoma and UPS, see the following:</p>

10887

10888 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10889

10890 <ul>

10891<li>

10892<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone" title="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone">

10893Bone Cancer Home Page</a>

10894</li>

10895

10896 <li>

10897<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/diagnosis-staging/ct-scans-fact-sheet" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/diagnosis-staging/ct-scans-fact-sheet">

10898Computed Tomography (CT) Scans and Cancer</a>

10899</li>

10900

10901 <li>

10902<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/drugs/bone" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/drugs/bone">

10903Drugs Approved for Bone Cancer</a>

10904</li>

10905

10906 <li>

10907<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/types/targeted-therapies" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/types/targeted-therapies">

10908Targeted Therapy to Treat Cancer</a>

10909</li>

10910

10911 <li>

10912<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/bone-fact-sheet" title="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/bone-fact-sheet">

10913Bone Cancer</a>

10914</li>

10915

10916 </ul>

10917</div>

10918

10919 <p tabindex="-1">

10920For more childhood <a class="definition" type="GlossaryTermRefs" href="https://www.cancer.gov/Common/PopUps/popDefinition.aspx?id=45333&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov" onclick="javascript:popWindow('defbyid','CDR0000045333&amp;version=patient&amp;language=English&amp;dictionary=Cancer.gov'); return(false);">

10921cancer</a>

10922 information and other general cancer resources, see the following:</p>

10923

10924 <div class="pdq-content-list">

10925

10926 <ul>

10927<li>

10929About Cancer</a>

10930</li>

10931

10932 <li>

10949Adolescents and Young Adults with Cancer</a>

10950</li>

10951

10952 <li>

10953<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/patient-education/guide-for-parents" title="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/patient-education/guide-for-parents">

10954Children with Cancer: A Guide for Parents</a>

10955</li>

10956

10957 <li>

10958<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/childhood-cancers/child-adolescent-cancers-fact-sheet" title="https://www.cancer.gov/types/childhood-cancers/child-adolescent-cancers-fact-sheet">

10959Cancer in Children and Adolescents</a>

10960</li>

10961

10962 <li>

10963<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/diagnosis-staging/staging" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/diagnosis-staging/staging">

10964Staging</a>

10965</li>

10966

10967 <li>

10968<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping">

10969Coping with Cancer</a>

10970</li>

10971

10972 <li>

10973<a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping/questions" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping/questions">

10974Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer</a>

10975</li>

10976

10977 <li>

10978<a href="https://cancercontrol.cancer.gov/ocs/resources/survivors.html" title="https://cancercontrol.cancer.gov/ocs/resources/survivors.html">

10979For Survivors and Caregivers</a>

10980 </li>

10981

10982 </ul>

10983</div>

10984

10985 </div>

10986

10987 </div>

10988

10989 <h3>

10990About This PDQ Summary</h3>

10991

10992 <div class="pdq-sections">

10993

10994 <div class="pdq-sections">

10995

10996 <section>

10997<h3>

10998About PDQ</h3>

10999

11000 <p tabindex="-1">

11001Physician Data Query (PDQ) is the National Cancer Institute's (NCI's) comprehensive cancer information database. The PDQ database contains summaries of the latest published information on cancer prevention, detection, genetics, treatment, supportive care, and complementary and alternative medicine. Most summaries come in two versions. The health professional versions have detailed information written in technical language. The patient versions are written in easy-to-understand, nontechnical language. Both versions have cancer information that is accurate and up to date and most versions are also available in <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/espanol/publicaciones/pdq" title="https://www.cancer.gov/espanol/publicaciones/pdq">

11002Spanish</a>

11003.</p>

11004

11005 <p tabindex="-1">

11006PDQ is a service of the NCI. The NCI is part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). NIH is the federal government’s center of biomedical research. The PDQ summaries are based on an independent review of the medical literature. They are not policy statements of the NCI or the NIH.</p>

11007

11008 </section>

11009<section>

11010<h3>

11011Purpose of This Summary</h3>

11012

11013 <p tabindex="-1">

11014This PDQ cancer information summary has current information about the treatment of osteosarcoma and undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (UPS) (formerly called malignant fibrous histiocytoma [MFH]) of bone. It is meant to inform and help patients, families, and caregivers. It does not give formal guidelines or recommendations for making decisions about health care.</p>

11015

11016 </section>

11017<section>

11018<h3>

11019Reviewers and Updates</h3>

11020

11021 <p tabindex="-1">

11022Editorial Boards write the PDQ cancer information summaries and keep them up to date. These Boards are made up of experts in cancer treatment and other specialties related to cancer. The summaries are reviewed regularly and changes are made when there is new information. The date on each summary ("Updated") is the date of the most recent change. </p>

11023

11024 <p tabindex="-1">

11025The information in this patient summary was taken from the health professional version, which is reviewed regularly and updated as needed, by the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/pediatric-treatment" title="https://www.cancer.gov/publications/pdq/editorial-boards/pediatric-treatment">

11026PDQ Pediatric Treatment Editorial Board</a>

11027. </p>

11028

11029 </section>

11030<section>

11031<h3>

11032Clinical Trial Information</h3>

11033

11034 <p tabindex="-1">

11035A clinical trial is a study to answer a scientific question, such as whether one treatment is better than another. Trials are based on past studies and what has been learned in the laboratory. Each trial answers certain scientific questions in order to find new and better ways to help cancer patients. During treatment clinical trials, information is collected about the effects of a new treatment and how well it works. If a clinical trial shows that a new treatment is better than one currently being used, the new treatment may become "standard." Patients may want to think about taking part in a clinical trial. Some clinical trials are open only to patients who have not started treatment. </p>

11036

11037 <p tabindex="-1">

11038Clinical trials can be found online at <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials">

11039NCI's website</a>

11040. For more information, call the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/contact-center" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/contact-center">

11041Cancer Information Service</a>

11042 (CIS), NCI's contact center, at 1-800-4-CANCER (1-800-422-6237). </p>

11043

11044 </section>

11045<section>

11046<h3>

11047Permission to Use This Summary</h3>

11048

11049 <p tabindex="-1">

11050PDQ is a registered trademark. The content of PDQ documents can be used freely as text. It cannot be identified as an NCI PDQ cancer information summary unless the whole summary is shown and it is updated regularly. However, a user would be allowed to write a sentence such as “NCI’s PDQ cancer information summary about breast cancer prevention states the risks in the following way: [include excerpt from the summary].” </p>

11051

11052 <p tabindex="-1">

11053The best way to cite this PDQ summary is:</p>

11054

11055 <p tabindex="-1">

11056PDQ® Pediatric Treatment Editorial Board. PDQ Osteosarcoma Treatment. Bethesda, MD: National Cancer Institute. Updated &lt;MM/DD/YYYY&gt;. Available at: <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq" title="https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq">

11057https://www.cancer.gov/types/bone/patient/osteosarcoma-treatment-pdq</a>

11058. Accessed &lt;MM/DD/YYYY&gt;. [PMID: 26389380]</p>

11059

11060 <p tabindex="-1">

11061Images in this summary are used with permission of the author(s), artist, and/or publisher for use in the PDQ summaries only. If you want to use an image from a PDQ summary and you are not using the whole summary, you must get permission from the owner. It cannot be given by the National Cancer Institute. Information about using the images in this summary, along with many other images related to cancer can be found in <a href="https://visualsonline.cancer.gov/" title="https://visualsonline.cancer.gov/">

11062Visuals Online</a>

11063. Visuals Online is a collection of more than 3,000 scientific images. </p>

11064

11065 </section>

11066<section>

11067<h3>

11068Disclaimer</h3>

11069

11070 <p tabindex="-1">

11071The information in these summaries should not be used to make decisions about insurance reimbursement. More information on insurance coverage is available on Cancer.gov on the <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/managing-care" title="https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/managing-care">

11072Managing Cancer Care</a>

11073 page.</p>

11074

11075 </section>

11076<section>

11077<h3>

11078Contact Us</h3>

11079

11080 <p tabindex="-1">

11081More information about contacting us or receiving help with the Cancer.gov website can be found on our <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact">

11082Contact Us for Help</a>

11083 page. Questions can also be submitted to Cancer.gov through the website’s <a href="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us" title="https://www.cancer.gov/contact/email-us">

11084E-mail Us</a>

11085.</p>

11086

11087 </section>

11088</div>

11089

11090 </div>

11091

11092 </div>

11093

11094 </div>

11095

11097

11098 <div class="document-dates">

11099

11100 <p>

11101Updated: <time datetime="2023-05-09T12:00:00Z">

11102May 9, 2023</time>

11103</p>

11104

11105 </div>

11109www.cancer.gov</a>

11110)</span>

11680

11681

11684
